short.text: Short demonstration of InteractionFilter and InteractionGroup's

long.text: A short demonstration of using Shape's InteractionFilter's and the more general (but less expressive) InteractionGroup's for controlling whether objects interact.
In the top scene, we have a set of circles which will not collide with eachother, and a set of hexagons which will not collide with eachother. But each circle 'will' collide with each hexagon
In the bottom scene, we have the reverse where the circles will collide amongst themselves, as will the boxes, but no circle will collide with any box.

Note: InteractionFilters are more powerful than shown here, specifically we're only dealing with collisions but InteractionFilter's can also be used to control (when applicable) whether two shapes will collide or interact as fluids for instance which is not currently possible using InteractionGroups
